div.l: Buttokes brode and brestes rounde and hye
But right feir was her here I wil not lye
The ꝑpersone of the towne for she was feire
In purpos was to make hir his heire
Both of his catelle and of his mesuage
And straunge he made hit of hir maryage
His purpos was to bestowe hir hye
Vnto some worthy blode of auncetrye
For holy churche goodes muste be spended
On holy church blode that is descended
Therfore he wold his holy blode honoure
Though that holy shold deuoure
Grete soken had this myller out of doute
Wᵗith whete and malte of al the londe aboute
And namly ther was a grete Colege

ÞMēnni MēnneÞei clepeth it the soler halle of Cambrigeor the scholler hall
aut a vniủersitatis sic dictoThe marginal note and underlining also seem to be by resp="1".
There was her whete ⁊and eke her malt y gronde
And on a day it hapned in a stounde
Seke lay the Manciple on a maladye
Men wende wysly that he shuld dye
Fro whom this myller stale both whete ⁊and corne
An hundred tyme more than he did beforne
For there before he stale but curteysly
But nowe he was a theff outrageously
For whiche the wardeyn chid ⁊and made fare
But therof set this myller not a tare
He craked bost and seyde hit was not so
Than were there poure clerkes two
That dwellen in this halle of whiche I sey
Testiff they were and lusty for to pley
And only for her myrth and revelrye
Vppon the warden besily they crye
